snippet: The endorsement gives the organic food processing company the right to label ingredients from one of its plants in Minnesota as free of gene-altered crops.
abstract: Agriculture Dept has allowed organic food processing company SunOpta to label ingredients from one of its plants as free from genetically altered varieties of corn and soy; issue is one of most contentious in food business, as many consumers are worried that genetically modified crops may be harmful, despite lack of scientific evidence.
lead_paragraph: The endorsement gives the organic food processing company the right to label ingredients from one of its plants in Minnesota as free of gene-altered crops.

headline.main: U.S. Approves SunOpta System for Detecting Genetically Modified Crops
